result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Brian Omar DeJesus-Pizaro in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Brian Omar DeJesus-Pizaro.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 

SPANISH INTERPRETER SWORN: Reme Bashi

Case set for status conference. State's witness is present. Attorney Fuentes has recently been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 11-01-2022
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Brian Omar DeJesus-Pizaro in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Reme Bashi
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian Omar DeJesus-Pizaro in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. BOTH APPEAR IN PERSON.   Sworn as interpreter: Bruce Goodman. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brian Omar DeJesus-Pizaro in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Brian Omar DeJesus-Pizaro in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brian Omar DeJesus-Pizaro appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
